intro: Psychotria daphnoides, commonly known as the "false holly" or "blue holly," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean, Central America, and northern South America, typically growing in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered white or pale blue flowers. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported medicinal properties. Psychotria daphnoides is also sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
